definition: to separate/to partition/to stand or lie between/at a distance from/after or at an interval of

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: I have curtained off this part of the room, where the bed is.
sentences.chinese: 我把房间里放床的这一边用帘子隔开了。

sentences.english: A domain name is divided into three segments and separated by periods.
sentences.chinese: 一个域名名称分三部分并由句点号分隔开。

sentences.english: Sometimes you need to escape a single quote as we'll see.
She separated the couple by drawing a river, the Milky Way, with her hairpin between them.
sentences.chinese: 她用金簪画出了银河隔开了这对夫妻。

sentences.english: The outputs of two consecutive cases will be separated by a blank line.
sentences.chinese: 两个连续的情形输出要用空白行隔开。

sentences.english: Circling the traps, he positions himself in between his son and the bear trap.
sentences.chinese: 他绕过那些陷阱，用自己的身体把儿子和捕熊器隔开。

sentences.english: A screen separated her bed from the rest of her one-room apartment.
sentences.chinese: 屏风把她的床与单间公寓的其他部位隔开来。

sentences.english: They partitioned the room off with a curtain.
sentences.chinese: 他们用一块帷幕把房间隔开。

sentences.english: The stretch of grass separating eastbound and westbound was more likely.
sentences.chinese: 隔开向东方向和向西方向的那片草地更有可能。

sentences.english: The master bedroom is separated from the rest of the house by a door and 3 windows.
sentences.chinese: 主卧室被与房屋的其余部分被一门三窗所隔开。

sentences.english: Separate the end cap from the bumper.
sentences.chinese: 将末端端盖和保险杆分隔开。

sentences.english: They’re sequestered between layers of silicone.
sentences.chinese: 它们被层层的硅树脂所隔开。

sentences.english: At the back of the room there is a boarded up doorway.
sentences.chinese: 房间的后面有个用模板隔开的门道。

sentences.english: Each card entry will be separated by a delimiter string.
sentences.chinese: 每个卡片条目由一个分隔字符串分隔开。

sentences.english: Is it any wonder they embrace a weirdness that baffles their elders?
sentences.chinese: 难怪他们作怪不断，隔开了长辈。

sentences.english: The colon separates the hostname from the display name.
sentences.chinese: 冒号将主机名与显示器名称分隔开。

definition: partition/to stand between/wall or fence serving as partition
to surround/to encircle/to enclose/to fence in
one divides into two/to be two-sided/there are two sides to everything/to see both sb's good points and shortcomings (idiom)
to separate/to partition/to stand or lie between/at a distance from/after or at an interval of
